data.name: message_proposal_not_exist
data.value: The proposal record either does not exist, or is inactive.

data.name: message_orig_proposal_invalid_qty
data.value: The proposal record must have a quantity of at least 2.

data.name: message_orig_proposal_invalid_status
data.value: The status of the proposal record must be new.

data.name: message_orig_proposal_invalid_cost
data.value: The minimum allowed proposal cost is 0.01 (and 1 for 0 DP currencies).

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_totalcost
data.value: The total cost of the subproposal records [(0)] must be equal to the cost of the original proposal record [(1)].

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_totalqty
data.value: The total quantity of the subproposal records [(0)] must be equal to the quantity of the original proposal record [(1)].

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_splitcount
data.value: There must be at least 2 items in the subproposal record sublist.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_cost
data.value: The split cost must be greater than 0.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_qty
data.value: The split quantity must be greater than 0.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_ongoing_generation
data.value: Assets are currently being generated from proposal records. Please wait for the asset generation process to finish before attempting to split a proposal. You can check the status of the current process on the Status page.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_invalid_min_amt
data.value: The minimum allowed resulting proposal cost is 0.01 (and 1 for 0 DP currencies).

data.name: message_client_script_not_found
data.value: The Client-script file cannot be found. Contact your account administrator for assistance.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_splitrem_invalidcostqty
data.value: You can split both the remaining proposal quantity and cost only if their value is greater than zero.

data.name: message_sub_proposal_splitrem_confirm
data.value: This will split the remaining proposal quantity and cost into individual proposal records. Do you want to continue?

data.name: custpage_propsplit_propid_help
data.value: This field shows the ID of the original proposal record.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_srctxn_help
data.value: The transaction this asset was generated from, or otherwise represents the acquisition of this asset.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_atype_help
data.value: Asset Type will default much of the asset configuration and is used to categorize assets in reports and other processes.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_splitrem_help
data.value: Check this box to split the remaining proposal quantity and cost into individual proposal records.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_method_help
data.value: Select the depreciation method (formula) to use when depreciating the asset. This Accounting Method will be used to calculate the values which will be entered into the accounting system.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_oc_help
data.value: The original (purchase) cost of the Asset.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_rvp_help
data.value:
The percentage value of the original cost which the asset will be worth at the end of its lifetime.

For example, an asset purchased for 1000.00 may be worth 100.00 at the end of its lifetime, so the residual value percentage would be 10% (10% of 1000.00 is 100.00).

Entering a Residual Value will always override the default value calculated using the percentage.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_rv_help
data.value:
The value which the asset will be worth at the end of its lifetime.

For example, an asset purchased for 1000.00 may be worth 100.00 at the end of its lifetime.

Entering a Residual Value will always override the default value calculated using the percentage.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_al_help
data.value: The expected lifetime of the asset, in multiples of the depreciation period (e.g. if depreciating monthly, enter lifetime in months).

data.name: custpage_propsplit_remcost_help
data.value: This field shows the remaining cost of unallocated assets.

data.name: custpage_propsplit_remqty_help
data.value: This field shows the remaining quantity of unallocated assets.

data.name: custpage_transferdate_help
data.value: Transfer date cannot be earlier than the Last Depreciation Date.

data.name: custpage_assetid_help
data.value: Select the ID or name of the asset that you want to transfer.

data.name: custpage_newassettype_help
data.value: Select the Asset Type where you want to transfer this asset to.

data.name: custpage_newsubsidiary_help
data.value: Select the Subsidiary where you want to transfer this asset to.

data.name: custpage_newclass_help
data.value: Select the Class where you want to transfer this asset to.

data.name: custpage_newdepartment_help
data.value: Select the Department where you want to transfer this asset to.

data.name: custpage_newlocation_help
data.value: Select the Location where you want to transfer this asset to.

data.name: custpage_assetdescription_help
data.value: Description of the asset is displayed here.

data.name: custpage_assetserialno_help
data.value: The serial number used to track or identify the asset.

data.name: custpage_assetnbv_help
data.value: The current book valuation of the asset.

data.name: custpage_assetlifetime_help
data.value: The expected lifetime of the asset, in multiples of the depreciation period (e.g. if depreciating monthly, enter lifetime in months).

data.name: custpage_assetlastdepr_help
data.value: This field displays the most recent last depreciation date from among the asset, the components, and their tax methods. If there is no last depreciation date or if the asset is new, the depreciation start date will be displayed instead.

data.name: custpage_assetcurrency_help
data.value: Book base currency of the subsidiary.

data.name: custpage_saveresults_help
data.value: Save Forecast Amounts lets you save the generated depreciation schedule entries (for the lifetime of an asset) in the asset record. When enabled, the system will ignore the Start Date, End Date, Net Book Value, and Period Depreciation. This ensures that the Depreciation History table will always have a complete depreciation schedule for the life of the asset. Values entered on the Start Date, End Date, Net Book Value, and Period Depreciation fields will be used only be used for the generated report.

data.name: custpage_showcomponents_help
data.value: Check this box if you want to view only the components on the report. Otherwise, clear this box to view only the parent compound asset on the report.

data.name: custpage_saveascsv_help
data.value: Check this box to save the generated report as a CSV file. When the setting is enabled, no XML or PDF output will be available.

data.name: custpage_assetinclude_help
data.value: Select which of the following assets to include in the report: All Assets, All Assets Except Leased, or Leased Only.

data.name: custpage_nodataforreport
data.value: Report data is not available for the combination of filters you selected.

data.name: custpage_advprinting_disabled
data.value: The Advanced PDF/HTML Templates feature must be enabled to generate this report.

data.name: ARR_desc_ARR
data.value: Generated by FAM. Asset Register Report

data.name: ASR_desc_ASR
data.value: Generated by FAM. Asset Summary Report

data.name: DSR_desc_DSR
data.value: Generated by FAM. Depreciation Schedule Report

data.name: custpage_showingdays
data.value: Showing reports from the last (0) days.

data.name: custpage_error_filepermissioninsuf
data.value: This role does not have View or higher file permission.

data.name: custrecord_systemsetup_suitetalkdesc
data.value: Enter credentials to use for SuiteTalk (web services) communications

data.name: custpage_run_script_on_csv_import
data.value: Run Server Scripts on CSV Import

data.name: custpage_farsetupcheckaplock
data.value: Post to Next Open Period if AP is Locked

data.name: custpage_farsetupcheckaplock_help
data.value: Check this box to allow posting to the next open period if AP is locked. Clear this box to allow posting to the current period even if AP is locked.

data.name: custpage_farsetupcheckarlock
data.value: Post to Next Open Period if AR is Locked

data.name: custpage_farsetupcheckarlock_help
data.value: Check this box to allow posting to the next open period if AR is locked. Clear this box to allow posting to the current period even if AR is locked.

data.name: custpage_userrole_help1
data.value: Allow Asset Value Editing gives the Administrator full permission to edit values in asset records.

data.name: custpage_userrole_help2
data.value: You can also select additional roles to allow other users to edit asset values.

data.name: custpage_followacctperiod
data.value: Use Accounting Period Dates for Depreciation

data.name: custpage_allowbypassue
data.value: Bypass Custom Record UE Scripts During Depreciation

data.name: custpage_adminallreports
data.value: Allow Administrators to View All Reports

data.name: custpage_farsetupreportfolder
data.value: Folder to use for reporting (internal id)

data.name: custpage_html_adminonly
data.value: Only administrators may access this page.

data.name: custpage_run_script_on_csv_import_help
data.value: Do not check this box if you are importing records of mid-life assets. If this box is checked and the Run Server SuiteScript and Trigger Workflows (Setup > Import > CSV Import Preferences) box is also checked, then information such as Cumulative Depreciation, Last Depreciation Date, and Last Depreciation Period will be auto-populated with default values of 0 even if true amounts are included in the import file.

data.name: custpage_precompute_help
data.value: Check this box to precompute depreciation values.

data.name: custpage_farsetuppostlocation_help
data.value: Check this box if assets will be transferred on location change, with accompanying Journal Entries.

data.name: custpage_farsetuppostclass_help
data.value: Check this box if assets will be transferred on class change, with accompanying Journal Entries.

data.name: custpage_farsetuppostdepartment_help
data.value: Check this box if assets will be transferred on department change, with accompanying Journal Entries.

data.name: custpage_constrainal_help
data.value: Check this box to restrict the addition to an asset record of an alternate depreciation method whose Asset Life (AL) value is greater than the lifetime of the asset.

data.name: custpage_farsetupwdusedepraccount_help
data.value: Check this box to post write-down amount to depreciation account. Clear the check box to post write-down amount to the asset account.

data.name: custpage_farsetupintcurrsym_help
data.value: Enter one or more currency symbols (for example, JPY, separate multiple values with comma) for currencies with no decimal places.

data.name: custpage_farsetupresrej_help
data.value: If this option is checked, the Reject Proposals button will only be displayed on the Asset Proposal page when accessed by users in the Administrator role.

data.name: custpage_farsetupreportfolder_help
data.value: Enter the internal ID of the Fixed Asset Register Reports folder in the File Cabinet where Fixed Asset reports are saved. To see the internal ID of the Fixed Asset Register Reports folder in your NetSuite account: 1. Go to Documents > Files > File Cabinet. 2. Click SuiteBundles. 3. Click Bundle 35405. 4. Click the src folder.

data.name: custpage_farsetupdisposalform_help
data.value: Enter the Internal ID of the preferred Invoice form to be used to create the Sales Invoice record when disposing an asset by Sale. If this field is left blank, the default preferred form will be used as the Invoice form.

data.name: custpage_farsetupsummary_help
data.value: Select a Summarize Journals By option: Parent - Roll up values of sub-assets to parent and create one journal entry to include parent and child values per period. Sub-Category - Roll up values to sub-category and create one journal entry per sub-category per period. This option can only be selected if Repair and Maintenance Categories and Repair and Maintenance Subcategories have been implemented. Asset Type - Roll up values by asset type.

data.name: custpage_farsetupfuturedepreciations_help
data.value: Check this box to permit depreciation of assets up to a depreciation date beyond that of the current period. Clear the box to depreciate assets to the current period only.

data.name: custpage_allowvalueedit_help
data.value: Check this box to give administrators full permission to edit values in asset records. If this box is not checked, asset records cannot be edited. See Restricting the Editing of Asset Values for the list of fields that cannot be edited. To allow other users to edit asset values, select additional roles from the User Roles field.

data.name: custpage_allownegativecost_help
data.value: Check this to enable administrators (and other roles with permission to edit asset values) to enter negative values - for original cost, current cost, and residual value - in asset records.

data.name: custpage_userrole_help
data.value: This is enabled when the Allow Asset Value Editing box is checked. To select two or more roles, press and hold down the CTRL key while you click each role in the User Roles field.

data.name: custpage_propapprovedonly_help
data.value: Check this box if you want to propose assets only from transactions that have been approved. Clear this box to enable automatic proposal of assets from all new transactions posted against the fixed asset general ledger accounts regardless of transaction status (for example, approved or pending approval).

data.name: custpage_followacctperiod_help
data.value: Enable this preference to use the accounting period dates for the depreciation journal entry. This is applicable if the Period Format is not in Calendar Months.

data.name: custpage_allowbypassue_help
data.value: Check this box to bypass the User-Event scripts and workflows for custom records during the Depreciation Process. Clear this box if you are running custom scripts and/or workflows on records that will be updated during the Depreciation Process.

data.name: custpage_allowcustomtransaction_help
data.value: Check this box to use a custom journal entry form

data.name: custpage_adminallreports_help
data.value: Check this box to allow administrators to view reports generated by other users

data.name: custpage_prefassetregtemplate_help
data.value: Select the preferred report template for Asset Register. Leave this blank if you want to use the default report template.

data.name: custpage_prefassetsummtemplate_help
data.value: Select the preferred report template for Asset Summary. Leave this blank if you want to use the default report template.

data.name: custpage_prefdeprschednbvtemplate_help
data.value: Select the preferred report template for Depreciation Schedule NBV. Leave this blank if you want to use the default report template.

data.name: custpage_prefdeprschedpdtemplate_help
data.value: Select the preferred report template for Depreciation Schedule PD. Leave this blank if you want to use the default report template.

data.name: err_no_def_template
data.value: The default report template cannot be found. Contact your account administrator for assistance.

data.name: err_precompute_off_disabled
data.value: You cannot disable the Precompute Depreciation Values preference.

data.name: custpage_assetid_help
data.value: Select the ID or name of the asset that you want to split.

data.name: splitquantity_help
data.value: Please enter a value less than the Asset Quantity.

data.name: custpage_newqty_help
data.value: The quantity separated from the original asset. This will now become the quantity of the new asset.

data.name: custpage_newoc_help
data.value: The default original (purchase) cost for the new asset based on the original asset's original cost and the split quantity. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default original cost.

data.name: custpage_newcc_help
data.value: The default current cost for the new asset based on the original asset's current cost and the split quantity. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default current cost.

data.name: custpage_newnbv_help
data.value: The default current book valuation for the new asset based on the original asset's net book value and the split quantity. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default net book value. Note that the sum of the Net Book Value and Depreciation To Date must be equal to the Current Cost.

data.name: custpage_newdeprtodate_help
data.value: The default total depreciation amount applied to date to the new asset based on the split quantity and the original asset's Depreciation To Date amount. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default total depreciation amount. Note that the sum of the Net Book Value and Depreciation To Date must be equal to the Current Cost.

data.name: custpage_newrv_help
data.value: The default value of the new asset's worth at the end of its lifetime. This value is based on the split quantity and the original asset's Residual Value. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default residual value.

data.name: custpage_newlastdepramt_help
data.value: The default last depreciation amount for the new asset based on the split quantity and the original asset's Last Depreciation Amount. Enter a new value if you do not want to use the default last depreciation amount.

data.name: custpage_oldqty_help
data.value: The remaining quantity for the original asset.

data.name: custpage_oldoc_help
data.value: The remaining original cost for the original asset based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_oldcc_help
data.value: The remaining current cost for the original asset based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_oldnbv_help
data.value: The remaining current book valuation for the original asset based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_olddeprtodate_help
data.value: The remaining depreciation amount applied to date to the original asset based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_oldrv_help
data.value: The remaining value of the original asset's worth at the end of its lifetime. This value is based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_oldlastdepramt_help
data.value: The remaining last depreciation amount for the original asset based on the split quantity.

data.name: custpage_disposaltype_help
data.value: The type by which the asset was disposed of.

data.name: custpage_conslineitemsoninv_help
data.value: Check this box to sum up the sales amount of all assets for disposal, and consolidate it into a single line item on the invoice. Clear this box to itemize each asset for disposal on the invoice.

data.name: custpage_html_invoicefail
data.value: Failed to create invoice for asset sale.

data.name: custpage_html_checksetup
data.value: Check setup of asset record for incompatible and/or missing data.

data.name: custpage_html_journalfail
data.value: Journal entry for asset sale not created.

data.name: custpage_html_journal_writeofffail
data.value: Journal entry for asset write-off not created.

data.name: custpage_assetquantdisposed_help
data.value: Quantity Disposed cannot be greater than the Asset Quantity.

data.name: custpage_disposaldate_help
data.value: Disposal date cannot be earlier than the Last Depreciation Date.

data.name: custpage_disposalitem_help
data.value: Only Non-Inventory Items for Sale or Resale can be selected.

data.name: custpage_filterslocation_help
data.value: If the Multi-Location Inventory (MLI) feature is enabled, asset disposal by Sale requires setting a Location value. If available, the location value is sourced from the FAM-Asset record by default and cannot be edited to prevent untracked location transfers. If not available from the asset record, you must select the value in the Location list on the Sale/Disposal page.

data.name: custpage_taxcode_help
data.value: Select a Tax Code applicable for the Customer's Subsidiary.

data.name: custpage_nodispacc
data.value: The asset cannot be disposed because the following disposal accounts have not been set for:(0)

data.name: custpage_inactiveacc
data.value: The asset cannot be disposed because the following disposal accounts are inactive:(0)

data.name: custpage_quantityerror
data.value: Quantity Disposed must be between (0) and (1)

data.name: client_confirm_change_type
data.value: This will reset all the values for (0). Do you want to continue?

data.name: client_confirm_reset_button
data.value: This will reset all the fields and remove all the added assets for disposal. Do you want to continue?

data.name: client_error_no_asset_to_dispose
data.value: Please select at least one asset to dispose.

data.name: client_confirm_add_compound
data.value: You have selected a compound asset. All of its components will be added to this page for disposal. Do you want to continue?

data.name: message_salestax_cust_invalid_sub
data.value: The subsidiary of sales tax code (0) and customer (1) do not match.

data.name: message_subsidiary_match
data.value: The subsidiary of the selected (0) does not match the subsidiary of this Asset.

data.name: message_subloc_notmatch
data.value: The location is not a part of the subsidiary. Change the value of the location or subsidiary.

data.name: message_field_is_ignored_for_asset
data.value: One or more assets cannot be processed because the (0) does not exist or is inactive.

data.name: message_missing_assetid
data.value: One or more entries cannot be processed because the asset ID is missing.

data.name: message_disposal_date_earlier_than_date
data.value: The disposal date (0) cannot be earlier than the last depreciation date (1).

data.name: message_disposal_compound_asset
data.value: Compound asset disposal through CSV import is not supported. To dispose compound assets, go to Fixed Assets > Transactions > Asset Disposal.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_asset_not_exist
data.value: The asset either does not exist, or is inactive.

data.name: message_disposal_date_format
data.value: The disposal date format of (0) is invalid. To check the date format, contact your account administrator.

data.name: message_asset_no_asset_vals
data.value: The asset has no asset values.

data.name: message_taxm_no_asset_vals
data.value: The tax method has no asset values.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_mandatory_headers
data.value: The required header fields are missing. The file must contain at least the following headers: Disposal Type, Disposal Date, Asset, and Quantity to Dispose.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_duplicate_headers
data.value: There are multiple instances of the header field: (0). Please remove duplicate columns.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_duplicate_lines
data.value: There are multiple instances of the same asset ID: (0). Please remove the duplicate entries.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_only_headers
data.value: The data for asset disposal is incomplete. The file must have values for the Disposal Type, Disposal Date, Asset, and Quantity to Dispose.

data.name: message_disposal_csv_extra_headers
data.value: The file has too many headers. Make sure that your file follows the format of the sample file on the Disposal via CSV Import page.

data.name: message_invalid_proposal
data.value: Proposal ID: (0) has already been processed or invalid

data.name: custpage_message_filestorefail
data.value: Unable to store temporary data required for report (nlapiSubmitFile)

data.name: custpage_message_temporarydata
data.value: Temporary data required by Fixed Assets Management Depreciation Schedule report

data.name: custpage_html_nbv
data.value: Asset Depreciation Schedule - Net Book Value

data.name: custpage_deprschedreport
data.value: Fixed Assets Management Depreciation Schedule Report

data.name: custpage_html_reporttruncated
data.value: Report truncated, reached maximum storage size.

data.name: custpage_html_noassetfound
data.value: No assets found for schedule report

data.name: custrecord_transactionprocessed
data.value: (0) transactions have been processed, (1) new assets have been created.

data.name: custpage_assetid_help
data.value: Select the ID or name of the asset that you want to revalue.

data.name: custpage_residualvalueerrror
data.value: Residual Value exceeds Original Cost or Current Cost

data.name: custpage_newdeprmethod_help
data.value: The new depreciation method to be used to depreciate this asset after revaluation.

data.name: custpage_newlifetime_help
data.value: The new lifetime of the asset after revaluation.

data.name: custpage_newresidualvalue_help
data.value: The new residual value of the asset after revaluation.

data.name: custpage_writedownperc_help
data.value: Enter to autofill write-down amount on the sublist below.

data.name: custpage_revaluationdate_help
data.value: Enter a date for the journal entry for this transaction.

data.name: custpage_revaluationmemo_help
data.value: Enter a reference to identify the journal entry for this transaction.

data.name: custpage_writedownamount_help
data.value: Enter a write-down amount. This amount is subtracted from the current net book value

data.name: custpage_accountingbook_help
data.value: Select the Accounting Books that are associated to this asset.

data.name: custpage_groupdeprerror
data.value: Revaluation not possible for Group Depreciating Alternate Depreciations

data.name: custpage_reval_date_error
data.value: Revaluation is not possible for records with revaluation dates earlier than the last depreciation date.

data.name: custpage_wdacct_missing
data.value: Missing or Inactive Write Down Account

data.name: custpage_deprchargeacct_missing
data.value: Missing or Inactive Depreciation Charge Account

data.name: custpage_plugin_not_parent_asset
data.value: Asset Record Id supplied is not the Parent Asset of Tax Method to be revalued.

data.name: custpage_no_tax_or_asset
data.value: Must provide either Asset Record Id or Tax Method Id to be revalued.

data.name: custpage_futuredateerror
data.value: Depreciation Period Date Cannot Be A Future Period.

data.name: custpage_deprmemo_help
data.value: Enter a depreciation reference to be used as the base reference on all generated journals. Leave blank to use default reference.

data.name: custpage_deprperiod_help
data.value: Enter a date up to which assets will be depreciated. Note that posted date will always be month-end.

data.name: custpage_postperiod_help
data.value: Select the period you want to post this transaction to. If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.

data.name: custpage_accountingbook_help
data.value: Select the Accounting Books that are associated to this asset.

data.name: client_depr_subsbooksmismatch
data.value: The selected accounting books are not associated to the selected subsidiaries.

data.name: message_depr_missing_deprdate
data.value: Depreciation Period should be provided as a parameter.

data.name: message_depr_date_earlier_than_min_date
data.value: The depreciation period (0) cannot be earlier than the minimum date (1).

data.name: message_depr_nobook_nodhrvalues
data.value: No DHR values fetched for Tax Method ID=(0).

data.name: message_depr_nobook_nomaxhashdate
data.value: No max hashdate fetched for Tax Method ID=(0).

data.name: custpage_filterenddate_help
data.value: Enter or select an end date for the report period you want.

data.name: custpage_filterstartdate_help
data.value: Enter or select a start date for the report period you want.

data.name: custpage_netbookvalue_help
data.value: Check this box if you want only the monthly net book value forecast to be displayed in the HTML report.

data.name: custpage_perioddepr_help
data.value: Check this box if you want only the monthly depreciation forecast to be displayed in the HTML report.

data.name: custpage_saveresults_help
data.value: Save Results is used for generating Depreciation Schedule entries for the lifetime of an asset, and for saving the entries in the asset record. When Save Results is checked, the system ignores Start Date, End Date, Net Book Value, and Period Depreciation to ensure that the Depreciation History table always contains a complete depreciation schedule for the life of the asset. The entered values on the Start Date, End Date, Net Book Value, and Period Depreciation fields will only be used for the generated HTML report.

data.name: custpage_header
data.value:
You can upload your CSV Import file to update Subsidiary, Department, Class, Location and Asset Type for multiple assets.
To record journal entry upon transfer, make sure Post on Department, Class or Location preference (Fixed Assets > Setup > System Setup) is enabled.
Please do not upload CSV file with both Asset Type and Subsidiary transfer.

data.name: custpage_stagestatustitle
data.value: FAM Process Stage Details for ID: (0), Name: (1)

data.name: custpage_errortitle
data.value: FAM Process Errors for ID: (0), Name: (1)

data.name: schedReportNBV
data.value: Depreciation Schedule Net Book Value Report

data.name: assetupdate_recoverymsg_dhr_slave_missing
data.value: Asset values or pre-computed depreciation history is missing for date key: (0)

data.name: assetupdate_recoverymsg_asset_taxm_missing
data.value: The asset and tax method are missing from the depreciation history.

data.name: checksummaries_name
data.value: Check for Missing Depreciation Schedule Summaries

data.name: dhrmapping_filesavingerror
data.value: Unable to save DHR mapping files: (0)

data.name: dhrmapping_missing_journal
data.value: Journal IDs were not passed as a parameter

data.name: precomputemigration_email_start_subject
data.value: Fixed Assets Management - Migration to Depreciation Schedule has Started

data.name: precomputemigration_email_start_body
data.value:
The migration process has started. You can check the status in the (0).
You will receive another email when the migration has been completed.

data.name: precomputemigration_email_end_subject

data.name: custpage_accounts_missing
data.value: One or more posting accounts are missing.

data.name: custpage_amounts_missing
data.value: The journal cannot be posted because there are no debit or credit amounts.

data.name: custpage_transfer_account_missing
data.value: Unable to locate valid transfer accounts from sub:(0) to sub:(1)

data.name: custpage_outside_period
data.value: The transaction date you specified is not within the date range of your accounting period.

data.name: custpage_setupmissing
data.value: The Fixed Assets Management System Setup record is missing or incomplete. Unable to determine system settings.

data.name: custpage_header
data.value:
You can import a CSV file to dispose your assets by sale or write-off.
Check the Consolidate Line Items on Invoice box to sum up the sales amount
of all assets for disposal, and consolidate it into a single line item on the invoice.

data.name: custpage_conslineitemsoninv_help
data.value: Check this box to sum up the sales amount of all assets for disposal, and consolidate it into a single line item on the invoice. Clear this box to itemize each asset for disposal on the invoice.

data.name: custpage_bulk_selectfile_help
data.value: Select the CSV file that contains the records you want to process.

data.name: assetrecord_assettypehelp
data.value: Asset Type will default much of the asset configuration and is used to categorise assets in reports and other processes.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdescrhelp
data.value: A brief description of the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_subshelp
data.value: The subsidiary associated with this record.

data.name: assetrecord_includechildhelp
data.value: Check this box to include assets of child subsidiaries.

data.name: assetrecord_assetserialnohelp
data.value: A serial number which may be used to track or identify the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcosthelp
data.value: The original (purchase) cost of the Asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcurrentcosthelp
data.value: The current cost of the asset. This will include any write-down amounts which have been applied to the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_residualvalpercenthelp
data.value: The percentage value of the original cost which the asset will be worth at the end of its lifetime. For example, an asset purchased for 1000.00 may be worth 100.00 at the end of its lifetime, so the residual value percentage would be 10% (10% of 1000.00 is 100.00). Entering a Residual Value will always override the default value calculated using the percentage.

data.name: assetrecord_residualvalhelp
data.value:
The value which the asset will be worth at the end of its lifetime. For example, an asset purchased for 1000.00 may be worth 100.00 at the end of its lifetime.
Entering a Residual Value will always override the default value calculated using the percentage.

data.name: assetrecord_assetacctmethodhelp
data.value: Select the depreciation method (formula) to use when depreciating this asset. This Accounting Method will be used to calculate the values which will be entered into the accounting system.

data.name: assetrecord_assetperiodconvhelp
data.value: Select the convention to use to define a year: 1. 12 months of 30 days each - This convention is generally used in North America and Europe, and produces more uniform monthly depreciation. 2. Exact number of days in a month, year has 365 days - This convention is generally used in Australia and New Zealand, and produces uneven depreciation within the year.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlifetimehelp
data.value: The expected lifetime of the asset, in multiples of the depreciation period (e.g. if depreciating monthly, enter lifetime in months).

data.name: assetrecord_assetdeprperiodhelp
data.value: The frequency at which depreciation of this asset should take place.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlifetimeusagehelp
data.value: If the depreciation of the asset is governed by the use made of that asset (e.g. vehicle mileage), the Lifetime Usage figure represents the total number of units available for the asset. When the total usage to date equals the Lifetime Usage, the asset will have reached the end of its lifetime.

data.name: assetrecord_assetnetbookvaluehelp
data.value: The current book valuation of the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcumulativedeprhelp
data.value: The total depreciation amount applied to date to the asset

data.name: assetrecord_assetstatushelp
data.value: The status of the asset: New, Depreciating, Fully Depreciated or Disposed

data.name: assetrecord_assetcustomerlocationhelp
data.value: The location of the customer from whom the asset was purchased.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcurrencyhelp
data.value: The currency the asset cost was originally expressed in.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcurrencyidhelp
data.value: Internal Id of the asset currency.

data.name: assetrecord_assetfixedratehelp
data.value: A fixed exchange rate, between the original cost currency (asset currency) and the base currency for the asset's company or subsidiary.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcustodianhelp
data.value: The employee responsible for the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetphysicallochelp
data.value: Indicates where the asset is normally located.

data.name: assetrecord_assetincludesreportschelp
data.value: Indicates whether the asset should be included in the Asset Summary Report. ult, all assets are included in the report.

data.name: assetrecord_assetpurchasedatehelp
data.value: The date of purchase of the asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdeprstartdatehelp
data.value: The date asset depreciation will start. For example, an asset may be purchased but not received or put into service until a couple of months later.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdeprenddatehelp
data.value: The date depreciation of the asset is expected to finish. This defaults to the asset's depreication start date plus the useful lifetime.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlastdeprperiodhelp
data.value: The period number (within the lifetime of the asset) in which the asset was most recently depreciated.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlastdepramounthelp
data.value: The value of the most recent depreciation of this asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlastdeprdatehelp
data.value: The date of the most recent depreciation of this asset.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdepractivehelp
data.value: Indicates whether the asset is active and included in depreciation processing. If the asset is related to a job, it may be set to become active automatically when the job is completed.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdisptypehelp
data.value: The type by which the asset was disposed of.

data.name: assetrecord_assetcustomerhelp
data.value: The customer the asset was sold to.

data.name: assetrecord_assetrevisionmethodhelp
data.value: Controls how revisions (revaluation) affect the asset. When 'Current Period' is selected, the depreciation of the asset to date is recalculated using the revised values, and the difference between the calculated depreciation and the previously posted depreciation is entered in the current period. When 'Remaining Life' is selected, the revision only applies to the asset from this point forward, so only affects future depreciation calculations.

data.name: assetrecord_assetnamehelp
data.value: The name of the asset that this record is associated with.

data.name: assetrecord_assetlocationhelp
data.value: Select a location if you want the report to only include assets associated with a specific location.

data.name: assetrecord_assetdepartmenthelp
data.value: Select a department if you want the report to only include assets associated with a specific department.

data.name: assetrecord_assetclasshelp
data.value: Select a class if you want the report to only include assets associated with a specific class.

data.name: assetrecord_report_subshelp
data.value: Select the subsidiary or subsidiaries for which you want to generate a report.

data.name: assetrecord_report_includechildhelp
data.value: Check this box to include assets of the child subsidiaries in the report.

data.name: assetrecord_report_assettypehelp
data.value: Select one or more asset types to categorize assets in the report. Note that default values will be assigned to most of the asset configuration based on the asset type.

data.name: assetrecord_assetperiodstartdatehelp
data.value: Enter or select a start date for the report period you want to generate.

data.name: assetrecord_assetperiodenddatehelp
data.value: Enter or select an end date for the report period you want to generate.

data.name: assetrecord_report_acctngbookhelp
data.value: Select the accounting book or books for which you want to generate a report.

data.name: assetrecord_report_typehelp
data.value: Select the type of report to generate.

data.name: client_altdepr_currency_mismatch
data.value: Currency of Alternate Depreciation should match Accounting Book currency when an Accounting Book is selected. Otherwise, currency should match Subsidiary or Company base currency.

data.name: custpage_lastdepramt_help
data.value: The value of the most recent depreciation of this asset.

data.name: custpage_lastdeprdate_help
data.value: The date of the most recent depreciation of this asset.

data.name: custpage_lastdeprperiod_help
data.value: The period number (within the lifetime of the asset) in which the asset was most recently depreciated.

data.name: custpage_nbv_help
data.value: The current book valuation of the asset.

data.name: custpage_cumulativedepr_help
data.value: The total depreciation amount applied to date to the asset.

data.name: custpage_priornbv_help
data.value: The assets net book value for the accounting method at the end of the prior financial year. The start and end of the year for the method is determined by the Financial Year Start field on the asset record. The Prior Year NBV is updated when the month being depreciated for the Accounting Method is the same as the month set as the Financial Year Start. This captures the NBV value as it was for the financial year that just ended.
